intro: Phryganocydia brevicalyx, commonly known as the narrow-leaved phryganocydia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and finely divided, aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and ecological niche.
